recipe.title: Peach Cobbler Stuffed ‘Beignets’ Recipe by Tasty

ingredients.ingredient: 1 tablespoon ; all-purpose flour, plus additional for dusting

steps.step: Add the butter and peaches to a pan over medium-low heat and cook until the butter has melted and peaches are glossy.

In a small bowl mix together the brown sugar, cinnamon, 1 tablespoon flour, and nutmeg. Sprinkle the sugar mixture over the peaches. Mix to combine and stir for 5-10 minutes until the mixture starts to thicken. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
On a floured surface, roll out the pizza dough to ¼-inch (0.63-cm) thick. Cut the dough into 20 rectangles.
Spoon 1 tablespoon of the peach filling onto a cut piece of dough. Fold the dough over lengthwise and crimp the edges so the filling is well sealed. Repeat with remaining dough and filling.
Heat oil in a large pot to 350°F (180°C).
Working in batches, fry beignets for 3-4 minutes each, flipping halfway, until puffy and golden brown.
Transfer beignets to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.

steps_updated.steps_updated: Add the butter and peaches to a pan over medium-low heat and cook until the butter has melted and peaches are glossy.
In a small bowl mix together the brown sugar, cinnamon, 1 tablespoon flour, and nutmeg.
Sprinkle the sugar mixture over the peaches.
Mix to combine and stir for 5-10 minutes until the mixture starts to thicken.
Remove from heat and set aside to cool.
On a floured surface, roll out the pizza dough to ¼-inch (0.63-cm) thick.
Spoon 1 tablespoon of the peach filling onto a cut piece of dough.
Fold the dough over lengthwise and crimp the edges so the filling is well sealed.
Repeat with remaining dough and filling.
Heat oil in a large pot to 350°F (180°C).
Working in batches, fry beignets for 3-4 minutes each, flipping halfway, until puffy and golden brown.
Transfer beignets to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
